{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Customer Service Representative",
  "description": "Naji Realties is a leading hospitality and real estate company in Nigeria, dedicated to providing exceptional services and experiences that exceed our customers&#39; expectations. With a strong presence in Abuja and Lagos, our experts are passionate about delivering top-notch solutions in property development, management, and hospitality. If you share our values and passion for excellence, we invite you to explore career opportunities with us. At Naji Realties, we foster a culture of growth, learning, and collaboration. Be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of hospitality and real estate in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Representative

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja&nbsp;(FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly skilled and enthusiastic Customer Care Officer to join our hospitality team.
	As the first point of contact for our guests, you will be responsible for delivering exceptional customer service, ensuring a warm and welcoming experience, and providing efficient front desk services.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet and welcome guests, respond to their inquiries, and resolve any issues promptly
	Manage room assignments, check-in, and check-out processes
	Handle guest registrations, payments, and departures
	Maintain accurate records of guest information, room assignments, and billing
	Provide personalized support and recommendations to guests
	Coordinate with other departments to ensure seamless service delivery
	Resolve guest complaints and issues in a fair, prompt, and professional manner
	Maintain a clean and organized front desk area
	Participate in training and coaching to enhance customer service skills


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Social Sciences or equivalent required
	Minimum of 2 years of customer service experience, preferably in the hospitality industry
	Must reside in Abuja, preferably around Utako
	Excellent communication, listening, and problem-solving skills
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities
	Strong patience, empathy, and understanding
	Proficiency in computer software and technology
	Ability to work varying shifts, including evenings and weekends.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@najirealties.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Naji Realties"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "189612"
  },

Customer Service Representative Job at Naji Realties




        
    

        
        Naji Realties is a leading hospitality and real estate company in Nigeria, dedicated to providing exceptional services and experiences that exceed our customers' expectations. With a strong presence in Abuja and Lagos, our experts are passionate about delivering top-notch solutions in property development, management, and hospitality. If you share our values and passion for excellence, we invite you to explore career opportunities with us. At Naji Realties, we foster a culture of growth, learning, and collaboration. Be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of hospitality and real estate in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Representative
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly skilled and enthusiastic Customer Care Officer to join our hospitality team.
	As the first point of contact for our guests, you will be responsible for delivering exceptional customer service, ensuring a warm and welcoming experience, and providing efficient front desk services.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet and welcome guests, respond to their inquiries, and resolve any issues promptly
	Manage room assignments, check-in, and check-out processes
	Handle guest registrations, payments, and departures
	Maintain accurate records of guest information, room assignments, and billing
	Provide personalized support and recommendations to guests
	Coordinate with other departments to ensure seamless service delivery
	Resolve guest complaints and issues in a fair, prompt, and professional manner
	Maintain a clean and organized front desk area
	Participate in training and coaching to enhance customer service skills


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Social Sciences or equivalent required
	Minimum of 2 years of customer service experience, preferably in the hospitality industry
	Must reside in Abuja, preferably around Utako
	Excellent communication, listening, and problem-solving skills
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities
	Strong patience, empathy, and understanding
	Proficiency in computer software and technology
	Ability to work varying shifts, including evenings and weekends.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@najirealties.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant / Executive Assistant",
  "description": "Yardoak Project is an indigenous woodwork, automation, and system integration company that has built a reputation for exceeding customer expectations by leveraging modern architectural techniques to create unique, distinct, and custom-made furniture designs for residential and commercial spaces.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant / Executive Assistant
Job Location:&nbsp;Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate financial records and ensure compliance with accounting standards.
	Prepare and analyze financial statements, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.
	Generate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports for management review.
	Conduct bank reconciliations and monitor cash flow to ensure adequate liquidity.
	Record daily financial transactions, including accounts payable and receivable.
	Process invoices, payments, and receipts efficiently.
	Monitor and reconcile bank statements and company accounts.
	Maintain an updated general ledger.
	Assist in the preparation of annual budgets and financial forecasts.
	Monitor budget performance and highlight variances to management.
	Support cost-control initiatives and identify opportunities for financial efficiency.
	Collaborate with the inventory and procurement team to ensure accurate financial tracking of stock purchases and usage.
	Assist in the financial reconciliation of stock levels with accounting records.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with experience.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;chika.umeugo@icloud.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-19",

Accountant / Executive Assistant Job at Yardoak Project




        
    

        
        Yardoak Project is an indigenous woodwork, automation, and system integration company that has built a reputation for exceeding customer expectations by leveraging modern architectural techniques to create unique, distinct, and custom-made furniture designs for residential and commercial spaces.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant / Executive Assistant
Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Maintain accurate financial records and ensure compliance with accounting standards.
	Prepare and analyze financial statements, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.
	Generate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports for management review.
	Conduct bank reconciliations and monitor cash flow to ensure adequate liquidity.
	Record daily financial transactions, including accounts payable and receivable.
	Process invoices, payments, and receipts efficiently.
	Monitor and reconcile bank statements and company accounts.
	Maintain an updated general ledger.
	Assist in the preparation of annual budgets and financial forecasts.
	Monitor budget performance and highlight variances to management.
	Support cost-control initiatives and identify opportunities for financial efficiency.
	Collaborate with the inventory and procurement team to ensure accurate financial tracking of stock purchases and usage.
	Assist in the financial reconciliation of stock levels with accounting records.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with experience.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chika.umeugo@icloud.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "DCS Engineer",
  "description": "SPIE Oil &amp; Gas Services (part of the SPIE Group) provides a complete range of services to some of the world&rsquo;s largest oil and gas companies through its network of offices in 25 countries across Africa, the Middle-East and Asia-Pacific.

Our turnover has more than doubled in the last few years thanks to the dedication of our 4,000 employees to whom we give training, recognition, and genuine opportunities for career development. In order to support this growth, SPIE Oil &amp; Gas Services is always seeking talented individuals to join its teams.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;DCS Engineer

Reference:&nbsp; 2025-40529
Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria

Job Description


	SPIE Services Nigeria Limited is currently looking for DCS Engineer to join its work force in Nigeria to perform condition monitoring, maintenance and troubleshooting of Control Systems, IT and communication systems.


Key&nbsp;Responsibilities


	Perform software maintenance of all relevant systems
	Assist with instrument maintenance and calibration functions
	Administrate Control Systems, Information Technology and communication systems modifications requests under management of change procedure
	Ensure sufficient stock of spare parts for Control Systems, Information Technology and communication systems
	Liaise with other departments for coordination of maintenance activities
	Liaise with Control Systems service provider and onshore Electrical &amp; Instrument and Information Technology support
	Follow system, rules, regulations and work procedures applicable to his
	responsibilities Familiar with the Computerized Maintenance Management System.
	Prepare required reports
	Ensure that vendors and contractors are managed safely and effectively
	Is responsible for the implementation of all OT Cyber-security measures onboard the FPSO.


Profile


	Experience in F&amp;G monitoring systems
	Experience in Subsea control systems would be preferred
	Basic understanding of system architecture and networks
	Experience in PLC, Allen Bradley, Siemens, ladder logic systems etc. plus related communication interfaces and Human Machine Interfaces (HMI) - and all Machine Monitoring Systems (Bentley Nevada) including GE System 1.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-30",

DCS Engineer Job at SPIE Oil & Gas Services




        
    

        
        SPIE Oil & Gas Services (part of the SPIE Group) provides a complete range of services to some of the world’s largest oil and gas companies through its network of offices in 25 countries across Africa, the Middle-East and Asia-Pacific.

Our turnover has more than doubled in the last few years thanks to the dedication of our 4,000 employees to whom we give training, recognition, and genuine opportunities for career development. In order to support this growth, SPIE Oil & Gas Services is always seeking talented individuals to join its teams.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: DCS Engineer

Reference:  2025-40529
Job Location: Nigeria
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Description


	SPIE Services Nigeria Limited is currently looking for DCS Engineer to join its work force in Nigeria to perform condition monitoring, maintenance and troubleshooting of Control Systems, IT and communication systems.


Key Responsibilities


	Perform software maintenance of all relevant systems
	Assist with instrument maintenance and calibration functions
	Administrate Control Systems, Information Technology and communication systems modifications requests under management of change procedure
	Ensure sufficient stock of spare parts for Control Systems, Information Technology and communication systems
	Liaise with other departments for coordination of maintenance activities
	Liaise with Control Systems service provider and onshore Electrical & Instrument and Information Technology support
	Follow system, rules, regulations and work procedures applicable to his
	responsibilities Familiar with the Computerized Maintenance Management System.
	Prepare required reports
	Ensure that vendors and contractors are managed safely and effectively
	Is responsible for the implementation of all OT Cyber-security measures onboard the FPSO.


Profile


	Experience in F&G monitoring systems
	Experience in Subsea control systems would be preferred
	Basic understanding of system architecture and networks
	Experience in PLC, Allen Bradley, Siemens, ladder logic systems etc. plus related communication interfaces and Human Machine Interfaces (HMI) - and all Machine Monitoring Systems (Bentley Nevada) including GE System 1.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Receivable Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Accounts Receivable Accountant will oversee all incoming payments, ensure accurate maintenance of financial records, and facilitate the prompt collection of outstanding invoices.


Key Requirements


	BSc. in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	5 years of experience in Accounts Receivable in manufacturing sector
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles (GAAP/IFRS).
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., SAP, QuickBooks).
	Advanced Excel and data analysis skills.
	Excellent attention to detail, accuracy, and organizational skills.
	Strong communication and interpersonal abilities for client follow-ups.
	Ability to work independently and meet tight deadlines.
	Professional certification (e.g., ICAN, ACCA) is an added advantage.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send&nbsp;a copy of their CV in MS word format to:&nbsp;jobs@cordyroseservices.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail",

Account Receivable Accountant Job at CordyRose Services




        
    

        
        CordyRose Services is a strategic recruitment firm that provide topnotch candidates for our esteemed clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Receivable Accountant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Accounts Receivable Accountant will oversee all incoming payments, ensure accurate maintenance of financial records, and facilitate the prompt collection of outstanding invoices.


Key Requirements
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	BSc. in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	5 years of experience in Accounts Receivable in manufacturing sector
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles (GAAP/IFRS).
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., SAP, QuickBooks).
	Advanced Excel and data analysis skills.
	Excellent attention to detail, accuracy, and organizational skills.
	Strong communication and interpersonal abilities for client follow-ups.
	Ability to work independently and meet tight deadlines.
	Professional certification (e.g., ICAN, ACCA) is an added advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of their CV in MS word format to: jobs@cordyroseservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail
